text: X Serotonin Syndrome |Neuroleptic < > W ET-H B Syndrome Inciting Agent Serotonin Agonist Dopamine antagonist (or withdrawal of dopamine agonists) Onset Abrupt (hours) Days to weeks Course Rapid (usually w/in 24 hrs) (exception: ~ Prolonged (days to weeks) fluoxetine) Neuromuscular Tremor, myoclonus, hyperreflexia Led-pipe rigidity, bradyreflexia Findings Pupils dilated normal Gl symptoms Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea Not usually present
